line_1: Ours were the Sins that bruis'd and pain'd
line_2: But O! with our Transgressions stain'd,

line_1: Of which the thought, my soul, so oft has pain'd?
line_2: How tell the loss, O, earth, by thee sustain'd;

line_1: If present, railing, till he saw her pain'd;
line_2: If absent, spending what their labours gain'd;

line_1: Like objects pleas'd them, and like objects pain'd;
line_2: 'Twas but one soul that in two bodies reign'd.

line_1: All Night to wake. With hunger is he pain'd,
line_2: I only with the prouling Wolf, constrain'd

line_1: By each offence my heart was pain'd,
line_2: True, I was not to virtue train'd,

line_1: By each offence my heart was pain'd,
line_2: My better thoughts my life disdain'd,
